content: This has a lot of potential to replace the original Plex app, which has a lot of issues. I watched few movies on MiBox 3 without crashing, something impossible with the original Plex. There is one feature, which is missing here and should absolutely be added - Refresh rate matching the content's rate. Here are other suggestions - enable/disable subtitles during playback; display OSD info; download missing subtitles; display clock; add options for audio passthrough; show remaining time. Good job!

great app, but one problem. i have several devices, but can only use this app on one device. i cant use it on more than one device otherwise it tells me i cant play anymore media. and when you own an app, you cant buy it multiple times with same account. please advise on how to use on multiple devices. ****update*** developer quickly dealt with refund request, so i felt i had to change my rating. but the ability to use multiple devices would be great in future, although developer never discussed
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback.

content: needs to be able to filter shows that are unplayed only
replyContent: Thank you for your opinion!

content: Seems like a cool app. now if there was live TV support or maybe an option to have a widget were we can click on the channel and it brings you straight to Plex live TV directly to the channel That would be amazing!!

content: Wow. *SO* much better than the official Plex app. So glad to find this! x265 10bit files actually play on my Google Pixel and thr interface is relatively uncluttered with simple access to all sections. Just needs Chromecast support and ability to scroll *down* list of movies... the left-to-right scrolling isn't right for portrait mode on a phone! Also, if the Plex account only has one server available --- auto connect! Don't pop up a list of 1 item as a choice!
replyContent:
Thank you for the review.
We plan to add the Chromecast support soon.
